instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pressing power button power on then off
threads.message: Hi I have a board that I change ISL On and I hit the power button it turns on then off I hit it again and it turns on no issue but it does this every time I power it up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pressing power button power on then off
threads.message:
Does the board turn on by itslef when you connect the charger?
Remove the battery for this test.
Be sure to use 85W charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pressing power button power on then off
threads.message: Yes it turn on by itself with out battery I have a original charger that is my test charger verified in system profiler. Itâ€™s weird because a PRAM solves it but when I remove the battery for a few days it resumes the same symptoms
